According to the GHE 2015 dataset, alcohol consumption accounted for 20·0% of all deaths due to cirrhosis and other chronic liver diseases and for 35·5% of all deaths due to liver cancer in mainland China ( table 2).
1 According to WHO estimates from 2016, age-standardised mortality from cirrhosis in adult Chinese men was 14·6 per 100 000 individuals per year and in women was 8·3 per 100 000 per year, with 62·6% (in men) and 41·6% (in women) of these being attributable to alcohol.
